pageContext.claim: “I hope he [Jim Mattis] does well. But as you know, President Obama fired him, and essentially so did I. I want results.”
pageContext.analysis: Trump did not fire Mattis. He resigned as secretary of defense Dec. 20 over disagreements with the president on how to handle Syria and other issues. Obama relieved Mattis of his position as head of U.S. Central Command in 2013 because his administration considered him too hawkish on Iran.
